title: Password Safety
description: Learn about what makes passwords strong or weak, and how you can make a strong password.

content.content: A password is generally safe when it is not easily guessable, uses a wide range of characters (ideally symbols too), and is not commonly used by a lot of people. It is also a good idea to make sure you don't repeat passwords between websites as well, in case one is subject to a data breach.

- Use many symbols.
- Make sure your password is reasonably long.
- Try not to use any english words
- Include upper-case and lower-case characters.

quiz.title: I should reuse passwords between websites.
